result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Latoya S Greer

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:08 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Latoya S Greer appeared by Zoom video.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty in court for Latoya S Greer.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Simon advises he had his client appear by Zoom today as she had transportation issues this morning.  Atty. Simon is requesting a short adjournment and a new plea and sentencing date.  Court will set a new plea and sentencing date back before Branch 2.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Latoya S Greer
Current: 517 Northport Dr., Apt. #6, Madison, WI 53704 United States  (Effective: 10-31-2022)
Prior: **UNKNOWN**,

Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
**Notice will be mailed to the defendant as soon as the Court receives an updated mailing address.**

2:10 PM Defendant Latoya S Greer not in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty in court for Latoya S Greer.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases were set for plea and sentencing. Atty Simon had filed an authorization.
Court does not have a current address for the Defendant. The last Notice of Hearing came back. 
Atty Simon advises the court he has had consistent contact with his client and will update the court as soon as possible.
State requests a capias be stayed until the next hearing. 
Court orders Defendant to appear in person for all hearings going forward, regardless of authorization. 
Clerk will work with the parties to reset the plea and sentencing hearing in October in front of a reserve judge.

Prior: 517 Northport Dr # 6, Madison, WI 53704

addressed to: Latoya S Greer for hearing on 09/16/22
Return to Sender, Unclaimed, Unable to Forward.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

NOT CALLED ON THE RECORD.
Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty in court for Latoya S Greer. Attorney appears by authorization. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Defense just received an offer today. Atty Simon requests time to discuss with his client, but requests a new plea and sentencing date for all cases.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant is in treatment.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on April 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

01:49 PM Defendant Latoya S Greer in court with attorney Thomas C Simon as a Friend of the Court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Charles Hoffman, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court addresses initial appearance in 22CM340.  
Defense acknowledes receipt of Criminal Complaint, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea to all charges.
Court sets signature bond.
Court extends Attorney Simon's appointment to cover 22CM340.
Defense is looking for a global offer and requests a further proceedings case.  
  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:42 AM Defendant Latoya S Greer not in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court adjourns to date and time with other case.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
